business.headline: Markets down, volatility up: 3 factors making Dalal Street investors nervousThe NSE Nifty50 has stumbled, dropping 3.2% in just eight trading sessions and slipping below the psychologically important 23,000 mark. The Sensex tells a similar tale of woe, falling over 3% to fall below 76,000.

Should you avoid smallcap, midcap stocks amid ongoing market correction?One of the primary reasons behind this downturn is the steep valuations of smallcap and midcap stocks, which analysts believe had reached unsustainable levels.

New Income Tax bill: What is tax year? How is it different from assessment year?The new bill aims to simplify the existing Income Tax Act and one of the key changes introduced in the New Income Tax Bill, 2025, pertains to the concept of the 'tax year.'

What is digital lending? 5 key benefits you should know Digital lending platforms make use of advanced technology, thereby making the loan process faster, simpler and more efficient.

New Income Tax bill: Has it really been simplified for taxpayers?The proposed income tax bill seeks to simplify and revamp the Income Tax Act of 1961, which has often been criticised for its complexity, making it challenging for ordinary taxpayers to navigate.

entertainment.headline: South Korean actor Kim Sae-ron, 24, found deadSouth Korean actor Kim Sae-ron, known for her roles in Bloodhounds and The Man from Nowhere, was found dead at her home in Seoul. She was 24. Authorities are investigating the circumstances of her death, with no signs of foul play reported yet.

The White Lotus S3 review: Predictable? Yes. Addictive? Also, yesReleased-Mon Feb 17, 2025The White Lotus Season 3 review: The White Lotus returns with a new season set in Thailand, offering a fresh cultural backdrop while retaining its biting satire on the ultra-rich. The series continues to entertain with its dark humour and ensemble cast, though its formula is starting to feel familiar. Read our full review.

Kanye West says he fought 5 hours for Grammy tickets amid guest list confusionRapper Kanye West, in a post on X, revealed that he fought for five hours to secure Grammy tickets amid guest list chaos. This comes amid claims that Kanye arrived at the event uninvited.

Comedian Anubhav Bassi's Lucknow show cancelled after warning over foul languageThe shows of comedian Anubhav Singh Bassi in Lucknow were cancelled due to concerns over inappropriate content, following a complaint by the UP Women's Commission vice-chairperson. Authorities cited potential law and order issues as reasons for the cancellation.

Watch: Chum Darang blushes as Karan Veer confesses love on Valentine's DayKaran Veer Mehra confessed his love for Chum Darang on Valentine's Day. Chum shared a post from their romantic outing on social media.
Watch: Ed Sheeran pauses Delhi concert as fan faints, wears Team India jerseyEd Sheeran wrapped up his India tour in Gurugram on February 15. He paused his concert briefly to help a fan who fainted.

Shalin Bhanot reacts to India's Got Latent Row, advocates self-disciplineTV actor Shalin Bhanot has reacted to the controversy surrounding YouTuber Ranveer Allahbadia's comment on India's Got Latent during the FDCI's India Men's Weekend in Jaipur. He emphasised self-discipline and responsibility.

Today is a victory: Jay-Z reacts after rape lawsuit against him droppedIn a significant legal victory, rapper Jay-Z has seen a sexual assault lawsuit against him dismissed. The rapper and entrepreneur expressed relief and satisfaction over the court's decision.

No one can save him: Mahabharat actor threatens Ranveer Allahbadia Actor Saurav Gurjar openly threatened Ranveer Allahbadia over his recent remarks on India's Got Latent. In a video message, the actor requested the government to take strict action against the podcaster.

Drake releases new album amid feud with Kendrick Lamar, fails to impress fansDrake appears to have ended his feud with Kendrick Lamar in his latest album, but fans remain unimpressed. Released on Valentine's Day, the album in collaboration with PartyNextDoor marks his first new work since the Super Bowl halftime show.

Bharti Singh supports Samay Raina amid India's Got Latent controversyComedian Bharti Singh supported Samay Raina amid the India's Got Latent controversy. The comedian praised Samay and said that he is very sweet, and anyone can become his fan once they get to meet him.

Women's panel summons Elvish Yadav over remarks against Chum Darang on Feb 17YouTuber Elvish Yadav has been summoned by a women's panel following his racist remarks against Chum Darang. Yadav criticised her name and nationality, sparking courage among northeastern citizens.

general news.headline: Turban thrown in dustbin, tortured in US detention camp: Deportee recounts horrorA 23-year-old man who was deported from the US to Amritsar along with 111 others on Sunday alleged he faced torture in a detention camp when he was caught entering the US illegally. He claimed he was in shackles on the deportation flight.

Gaffe machine Sam Pitroda says China issue 'blown out of proportion', blames USDuring Prime Minister Narendra Modi's visit to Washington last week, US President Donald Trump offered to mediate in the India-China border dispute. The offer was, however, rejected, with Foreign Secretary Vikram Misri saying New Delhi would approach a bilateral approach.

4.0 magnitude earthquake jolts Delhi-NCR out of sleep, big tremors, rumbling noiseA 4.0 magnitude earthquake hit Delhi-NCR early on Monday with its epicentre in the national capital. The tremors lasted for a few seconds and caused panic among residents.

Delhi Chief Minister's oath likely on February 20 after key BJP meet: SourcesOut of 48 BJP legislators who won in the recently-concluded Delhi Assembly elections, 15 names have been shortlisted -- nine will be selected for key posts of the Chief Minister, state cabinet ministers and the Speaker -- according to sources.

Why Delhi's 4.0 earthquake felt stronger than it wasStrong tremors jolted Delhi-NCR residents out of sleep on Monday morning due to a 4.0 magnitude earthquake that shook buildings and left people terrified. But, was the earthquake as strong as it felt?

The state of the mob and the failure of the stateAt the New Delhi railway station on Saturday night, a "sea of humanity" travelling for a Kumbh dip was waiting for the train to Prayagraj. A platform-change announcement triggered a tsunami in that sea. Faith, fate, and a whole lot of frantic feet. India has a mob problem.

Ex-poll body chief Quraishi denies US funding claim for voter turnout in IndiaFormer CEC SY Quraishi rejected DOGE's claim of granting funds for boosting voter turnout in India and termed the reports baseless.

Extra tickets for India vs Pakistan match in Dubai sold out within hoursChampions Trophy 2025: The ICC announced the sale of additional tickets for India's matches in Dubai on February 16. The India vs Pakistan tickets were gone in hours.

Blocked from speaking to my son, haven't seen him in 2 years: Shikhar DhawanFormer India cricketer Shikhar Dhawan expressed his longing to meet and embrace his son. The Champions Trophy winner said it has been two years since he last saw Zoravar and a year since they last spoke.

Yashasvi Jaiswal ruled out of Mumbai's Ranji semi-final due to injuryYashasvi Jaiswal faces a double setback as an ankle injury ruled him out of Mumbai's Ranji Trophy semi-final against Vidarbha, days after his exclusion from India's Champions Trophy squad in a last-minute selection change.

If Haris Rauf has a side strain, he cannot play Champions Trophy: Mohammad AmirFormer pacer Mohammad Amir has expressed his doubts about Haris Rauf's fitness and feels he may not be able to play the Champions Trophy if he has got a side strain. Rauf got injured during the opening match of the tri-series but was deemed to be fit in time for the Champions Trophy.
